name: ListSubscriptionEvents
description:
Retrieve events for a specific subscription.

Call this tool to retrieve all events related to a specific subscription using the Square API. Useful for tracking changes and updates within a subscription lifecycle.

parameters.name: subscription_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the subscription to retrieve events for. Use this to specify which subscription's events to list.

value_schema.description: The ID of the subscription to retrieve the events for.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Specify the cursor to fetch the next set of subscription events if results exceed the limit. Leave unset for the last page.

value_schema.description:
When the total number of resulting subscription events exceeds the limit of a paged response, 
specify the cursor returned from a preceding response here to fetch the next set of results.
If the cursor is unset, the response contains the last page of the results.

For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination).

parameters.name: max_events_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of subscription events to return in a single response page.

value_schema.description:
The upper limit on the number of subscription events to return
in a paged response.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the squareup API.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
When the total number of resulting subscription events exceeds the limit of a paged response, 
specify the cursor returned from a preceding response here to fetch the next set of results.
If the cursor is unset, the response contains the last page of the results.

For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination).

value_schema.description:
When the total number of resulting subscription events exceeds the limit of a paged response, 
specify the cursor returned from a preceding response here to fetch the next set of results.
If the cursor is unset, the response contains the last page of the results.

For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The upper limit on the number of subscription events to return
in a paged response.

value_schema.description:
The upper limit on the number of subscription events to return
in a paged response.

parameters.name: subscription_id
parameters.description: The ID of the subscription to retrieve the events for.

value_schema.description: The ID of the subscription to retrieve the events for.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
